comment: Caring woman and I definitely enjoyed her. She is a bit particular at times about homework and stuff so that would sometimes be annoying but she is definitely a good professor. LOTS of homework that takes forever, but that is just how chem 1212L is, that is unavoidable and isnt something because of her. Overall she is good!

Professor Single is very understanding and explains things clearly. She's one of the best professors I've ever had! Make sure to do the lab notebook before class and have all the tables. She's a tough, fair grader, so don't forget even small details like the amount of significant figures. She's always open to questions during and after class.

she is VERY picky with her grading and WILL take off points for literally anything and everything, it doesnt help that we have very few grades in the gradebook so if you fail one lab report your entire grade goes down :( i honestly would not rec if you want an easy lab, she is way too picky and strict.
Don't take her lab or class ,  you will end up dropping. She's really picky.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Professor Single is an amazing professor that I would recomend to anybody who needs an intro chem lab! She is incredibly nice, and really explained concepts better than my main chemistry lecture. With that being said it is quite a bit of work outside of class (especially prepping the lab notebook), but if you do the work, this lab is a breeze.

I was teribble at chemistry in highschool but when I tell you she made it as easy as possible to understand, all of her lectures are posted online so u can pause and take notes at your own pace, just keep up with due dates, and start studying for the final using the ACS official study guide about 3 weeks in advance you should be able to get an A

The class is paced pretty fast, but she lectures well. She gives time for Q&As during class and plenty of in-class practice with the topics. Attendance isn't required, but missing a lecture will set you back a good bit. Be ready to take notes and do a sizeable amount of homework.

Chemistry is a hard subject but she taught it very well. She is extremely nice and would make time before and after the lecture for questions. She would work out 90% of the Powerpoint problems in class. There is a good bit of homework and the content isn't easy but practicing outside of lecture and going to SI helped a lot. TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.

If you're a responsible student you won't even need to attend the in person classes and can just watch them online- skipping through filler. Mrs. Single is actually the sweetest too and cares so much about her students. Her explanations were amazing and she is so easy to follow. Highly recommend taking.

She is a great teacher and gives very in-depth lectures. She records and posts all of them so you can always look back when studying. She also offers zoom sessions for every class session. She doesn't curve exam scores but the tests she makes aren't too difficult. Do your homework assignments and she will help your grade!

A wonderful professor who's always willing to work with students. She made chemistry alot easier than it could've been and had so many resources to help with exam studying etc. Honestly, no complaints! Great class and great professor (although her lectures can kinda get boring, but it's chemistry what do you expect lol)

This was the best Chemistry class I had ever taken. She cared about what she was teaching and taught it well too. I will say that you got to pay attention because she goes through those slides but you can access the class recording in d2l if you missed anything.

Great Professor and is very nice. Only downside is the lectures are often quite boring and don't have many examples. If you do not like long PowerPoint lectures and taking notes, try to stay away. Other than that great!
Kind professor with good teaching skills. Would take again and will the class.

Great professor, easy to get an A if you put in the work. She tends to go over the lecture fast, but she posts past sessions online. I recommend going to SI sessions if you can because it helps a lot. Ms. Single allows a cheat sheet for the first few exams. She also specifies what need you to memorize for the tests.

Great teacher, gives good lectures trying to fit all the information for upcoming tests. there are plenty of resources given and many examples in order to make sure you understand. slight disclaimer, she will explain things and will go very quickly through the content while there are a few small things that are missed.

Professor Single is very kind. She's accessible, smart, and wants her students to do well. Her lectures aren't very fun, but there are activities in class that help with learning the content a lot. Very generous with due dates/late work. Only down-side is that sometimes she isn't very clear when answering questions, but she'll work with to get it.

Professor Single is awesome! Her lectures are very detailed with lots of examples to make sure that students understand the material well. There isn't a lot of extra work outside of homework and tests, which are easy for the most part. She is very kind and even allows you to use a notes sheet for the first two exams. Definitely would take again!

I took Professor Single for a dual-enrollment class. Work was very manageable and followed a similar format each week. Lots of lecture information, so take good notes and pay attention. She really wants her students to succeed. Professor Single was open to addressing questions and explaining things more. I would definitely take her again!

Super super boring lectures where she just reads off a PowerPoint and then spends over half the class doing maybe two examples. Tests are all multiple choice though so it's not too hard to average a C on tests and there's so much homework that you could get C's on her tests and still get a B. She does curve grades a little at the end.

I took Chem1211 with Mrs. Single and I can say she is definitely a great teacher. She is really helpful and will take the time to help you with any questions/problems you may have. She really emphasizes putting in the effort and trying. And if you do put in effort and try you will definitely get a good grade in the class.

Chem is a hard course, but u want this teacher. Records all her lectures, gives a cheat sheet for the first two tests and replaces an exam grade with your final exam grade if the final exam grade is higher. Final exam is very hard, so study hard. Buy the ACS study guide book, it helps. Go to SI sessions, and ask plenty of questions.

Take Dr Single! Chemistry is already a hard subject but if you put in the effort and ask questions, she will make sure to be there for you and help you out! The class consists of weekly homework, daily quizzes, 4 tests, and a cumulative ACS final. You are allowed to have a cheat sheet only on the first 2 tests. Take her, you won't regret it!!

I failed not because of her but life got in the way. I did want to clear up some of the older reviews. She no longer drops the lowest test score, each section you score on the final will replace each exam grade. She only lets you use a cheat sheet for the first 2 tests. (Which are the easier ones imo). Take her but be prepared to study.

Mrs. Single was a very nice professor and always helped out if you have questions! We also have SI's in the class, so definitely go to their sessions! The class is pretty difficult, but Mrs. Single provides many resources to help you do well!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Maybe it was because I was a freshman and not ready for her class but I really felt like she was not helpful to me. I struggle with chemistry and fell behind early, and she gave me almost no help despite me trying all semester.

Professor Single is great! The hardest part of her class was the final exam which is written by ACS, not her. Chemistry is a very hard subject, but she made the class easier and understandable by thoroughly explaining things.

She offers a ton of resources to make sure you pass the class. Only takes 1% off homework each day it is late. There is a check-in quiz every day(10%), homework every week(10%), 4 tests(60%), the ACS(20%), and offers some extra credit. You can join on zoom every day and she posts recordings of the lectures. If you go to SI you will pass with B/A.

Chemistry is a tricky class, but Mrs. Single made it seem more straightforward. She provided lots of practice problems, SI sessions, and recorded lectures. The tests are similar to the practice tests, and you are allowed to use 1 page of notes for it. She also gave out bonus points on two of the tests.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Class is tough at some points, but Professor Single gives a lot of resources like good study guides and SI sessions to help us succeed
Utilize your SI and the class will be ok. It's tough but Single is really accommodating and is not out to get you like some of the other chem professors.

While I didn't do well in this class, it is entirely my fault. Personally, I hate chemistry and only took the class because my advisor recommended it and I didn't fully understand how degreeworks worked and that I had options. Still, she was a very nice professor and definitely seems like a good choice but be warned, her lectures are super boring.

Professor single is an amazing professor to say the least. Chemistry is a very difficult subject to grasp and she tried her absolute hardest to make it so you could understand it. One of the nicest professors I've ever had. She lets you use a sheet on exams to help you, and drops the lowest test grade. 100 percent recommend her.

Can't say enough good words about Dr. Single. I went into this class with little knowledge of chem and ended with an A+. I looked foward to her class because she was fun and engaging and did lots of helpful practice problems. We also did a jeporady game that added up to 10 points to an exam. Best professor I have ever had. Wish she taught chem 2.

Dr. Single was a wonderful and caring teacher. She always took the time to thoroughly explain the content and was always open after class for questions. Her passion for chemistry is radiant and she helped me gain a new appreciation for this subject. I also thank her for being mindful of us, and allowed us to attend meetings virtually if needed.

Best prof I ever had, super nice and a great teacher.
A lot of homework, gives 4 unit exams but only best 3 count.
If you don't take her I feel sorry for you.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Ms. Single is one of the best professors I have taken at KSU. She is very caring for her students and considers the work load. If you miss an assignment, she will allow you to go back and complete it. She lets you use a "cheat sheet" for every test. Her grading style drops a lot of bad grades so it's hard not to pass this class!

I would say I was ok at chemistry until I took Mrs. Singles. Literally the best teacher I ever had for chemistry. She is very carrying and is here to HELP you!! You are allowed to use notes on test and there are small assignments that are due at the end of the week but they aren't difficult. She will help you succeed if you show any effort!!

I love Yvonneee soo muchh. She is so nice and very helpful. She lets us use cheat sheets on every test except the final. Having the cheat sheet, is kind of crippling because you rely on it so much that you are trying to remember so much info for the final. But overall def take her

The best chemistry prof ever. Ive had a very difficult time learning chem and she made it so easy. She's so passionate and wants everyone to succeed, and shes very helpful with questions (no questions are stupid questions to her). I could not recommend her more as a prof. There is a lot of hw (not her hw its ksu) but she is very lenient with grades

Take her. Used to teach the lab too so she able to help you with that. Great teacher and very intelligent. She's quiet and shy but don't be afraid to speak up; she's amazing at helping you if you need extra help. Good class for many types of learners.

Ms Single's chem class is the easiest you will ever take. She is knowledgable and sweet and makes this class an easy A. Attendance isnt mandatory, but she does a participation grade almost every week, occasionally with the opportinunity for bonus points. Take her if this is your science elective and you want an easy A. Take her!!!

Professor Single is amazing! She is really here to help you out and does a great job! You are allowed to handwrite formulas/notes on your periodic table to use on the exams. There are so many opportunities to get help from her, the SI and student assistants. The grade is homework/participation/test/final. Make room on your schedule for her class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Single is awesome. While there are some difficult concepts to grapple in Chemistry 1211, she makes everything very clear and goes over material at a slower and reasonable pace. She was available outside of class and always willing to answer questions and clarify things. What she expects you to know for the tests is very clear.

Awesome professor.  Really takes the time to answer any questions you may have.  Always finds time for students to help them.  Chemistry is tough but she makes it easier with her lectures and extra help.  Patient, kind, and attentive.  She is great!

Professor Single is such an amazing professor. She has a such a deep understanding of chemistry and does a phenomenal job transporting that information into your brain while simultaneously being so caring and overall awesome! Take her.

Professor/Dr. Single, has got to be one of the best professors I've ever had! She's very caring & wants to make sure you actually understand what's being taught! There's opportunity to make up homework, gives extra credit & post the lectures online so you can always go back. SI sessions helps big time! I wish she's teaching 1212 :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: She's socially awkward so be prepared for that be prepared to study A LOT,  and GET Clutch prep! I went from C to A just like that, & the lowest test grade will be dropped, don't forget about the ACS exam/aka the chem final, start practicing for that ASAP, it doesn't come from her tests, she provides practice exams for her tests tho.

Great chem professor. Lectures a little confusing but Professor Single 100% wants you to pass. Homework definitely on the heavy side and its for a grade so it'll punish you if you don't do it at all. She made Chem super manageable and the tests were easier than expected. Went to the major review SI sessions before tests and had me pretty much set.

She raised her voice at me in front of the class. She was frustrated that I was late and forgot to don safety glasses. I have ADHD accommodations. She threatened to dismiss me from her class for the semester, even though she herself didn’t notice my mistake for the entire 3 hour lab. It was inappropriate and embarrassing to be berated like that.

Honestly Professor Single is a great, very caring person. Helpful when I needed help. Her main con in my opinion is the fact that her lectures are somewhat hard to follow. Very jumpy and back and forth with her explainations of things. Also expect a ton of homework on SmartWork

Prof. Single isn't the best at explaining during lectures, however she truly cares for students and will stay on a subject or outside of class to make sure you understand the material. She records lectures and opens up late assignments. She wants to make sure you get an A as long as you put in minimal effort.

She made 1211 about as easy as it can get. Offers lots of help sessions as the material can be pretty overwhelming at times. The homework is on the heavy side and is usually more difficult than what will be on the test or gone over in class, but it is counted for a grade so it can get pretty frustrating. Easy grade if you put in the effort.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Honestly the best Professor Ive ever had. Graded on 4 tests, a bunch of hw (they were easy), in class assignments, and the final. She is so sweet and caring! I would 1000000% take her again if she were teaching Chem 1212. Lectures really helped understand the material. Tests were honestly quite easy. Much respect for Ms. Single!

She was great overall! There is a pretty good amount of HW but it wasn't too terrible. She mainly does lectures. Provides a study guide for each exam which was VERY helpful. HW was online but never had to use the textbook. Easy to contact and communicate with. She didn't take attendance, but sometimes did a class question that counted as attendance
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Single was a great professor! I took her over the summer for Chem 1211 and she was so accommodating an understanding! Her tests are reasonable, but there is a good bit of homework (not too bad though). Take her!

Attend the lab, come prepared, reach out for any help you need. As long as you do the work and learn the material, she will help you. She met with me on weekends many times to help me with my lab report. Phenomenal lab professor and I would highly recommend.

Prof. Single is an excellent professor. Chemistry is always going to be challenging, but she made it easier by caring for her students and just being a gifted teacher in general. I would recommend her to anyone taking chemistry.
Just know that you have to work hard for this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Ms. Single did awfully adapting to the online format. She didn't provide study guides for any tests we had and would often not cover topics and then decline to take the corresponding homework's down. I felt blind going into every test despite hours of aimless studying. She apparently was a fine lab teacher but stay far away from her for Chem.

Go to lab, every time. Do not get behind on Lab flow. DO your lab notebook, thoroughly, and correctly, because she will make you correct it. She is very helpful on feedback, and gives you chances to do better. Make sure you upload everything into Lab flow as a PDF because she will give a 0. I recommend her if it is your first time taking lab.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Don't know how I got an A, but she was really nice and pretty helpful. I had the class late at night so I was usually ready to go to bed so it was not too exciting. The class was pretty okay though. Definitely do your lab notebook every time and be ready for your pre-lab quizzes. The final was easy.

One of the best lab professors Ive taken. Shes respected, caring, explains things clearly, and grades things clearly. Quiz before every lab based on previous lab & current lab. Requires your lab notebook to be very organized, which helps you with the lab quizzes. 100% would take her again!!

I took Professor Single for lab, and she was amazing. She explained things in great detail, but she is picky on sig figs and excel graphs. She is so sweet though and is very helpful and always available.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Single was a wonderful lab professor! It is evident that she genuinely cares about her students and their success in her class. I took her summer lab, so there were two labs per week, but it actually felt less stressful than my regular semester Chem 1211 lab with one lab per week. I would highly recommend Professor Single!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Prof single was very helpful in the end she let me redo 4 of my lowest lab reports I would 100% take her again
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Really nice teacher! She explains thoroughly, and is easy to talk to. She takes points off for sig figs, which can add up, but lots of opportunities for extra credit.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Single is amazing! She's really hard on SigFigs, but that's just something you have to perfect in chemistry. I highly recommend her because she actually takes the time to give feedback on reports. The lab reports are pretty straightforward with pre-lab quizzes before each class. Drops two quizzes and one lab report. Extra credit too!

Professor Single is great! I think that she is not a harsh grader at all compared to other lab professors. Ask all the questions you have because she will explain how to complete it without hesitation. She's very caring and sweet and it isn't hard to make an A unless you don't show up to class. Take her!!

I took Prof Single for AMP CHEM 1211 Lab. She's a pretty harsh grader considering the lab curriculum doesn't follow the lecture curriculum. She's perfectly nice and as long as you do your lab notebook and reports every week, it's not impossible to make an A, but difficult enough.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK
